Package com.bbtutorials.users.dao

Class AccountDao

java.lang.Object
com.bbtutorials.users.dao.AccountDao
@Component
public class AccountDao
extends java.lang.Object
The class used to interact with DynamoDB for accounts (and friends). The DynamoDBMapper object is autowired in as a singleton to ensure the proper credentials are used each time an API is called.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    AccountDao​(com.amazonaws.services.dynamodbv2.datamodeling.DynamoDBMapper mapper)  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Account createAccount​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)
    Creates an account for a new user by taking in their username, email, and password.
    Account login​(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)
    Returns the account for the user specified by the email argument when the login is successful, wherein the decrypted password from DynamoDB matches the plaintext one specified by the password argument.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • AccountDao

      @Autowired public AccountDao​(com.amazonaws.services.dynamodbv2.datamodeling.DynamoDBMapper mapper)

  • Method Details

    • createAccount

      public Account createAccount​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password) throws javax.security.auth.login.AccountException
      Creates an account for a new user by taking in their username, email, and password. The password is encrypted and then updated in the account created that will be saved to DynamoDB. When creation is successful, the newly created account is returned to make an authentication key later on. When unsuccessful, an exception is thrown to depict failure of the operation. Accounts initially start out with no friends.
      Parameters:
      username - the username for the new user
      email - the email address for the new user
      password - the plaintext password for the new user
      Returns:
      the created account for the new user
      Throws:
      javax.security.auth.login.AccountException - when the supplied user information is invalid

    • login

      public Account login​(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password) throws javax.security.auth.login.FailedLoginException
      Returns the account for the user specified by the email argument when the login is successful, wherein the decrypted password from DynamoDB matches the plaintext one specified by the password argument. When unsuccessful, due to either an invalid email or password supplied, an exception is thrown to depict failure of the operation.
      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the user logging in
      password - the plaintext password of the user logging in
      Returns:
      the account for the logged in user
      Throws:
      javax.security.auth.login.FailedLoginException - when the email or password supplied is invalid
